cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles ESE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west and then west-southwest toward the south-central Texas coast before moving inland into northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: between Port Mansfield and Mesquite Bay, TX (near Corpus Christi)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mesquite Bay to High Island, Texas (includes Galveston Bay region)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from the mouth of the Rio Grande northward to High Island, with greatest impacts south of Sargent
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts could reach 35–40 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible in Galveston Bay and adjacent coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could drop 3–5 inches with isolated higher pockets, producing localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf, dangerous rip currents, and peripheral squalls.
